title: Around the World in Eighty Days

quoteFirst: Will be evening star during the month, setting at the following times: On the 1st, at
quoteLast: ; on the 15th, at 10:29 p. m.; and on the 31st, at 9:28 p. m. Its motion is direct, and about 45′. Its diameter, 2.6″. On the 2nd, at 12:30 p. m., 27′ north of moon; on the 29th, at 9:06 p. m.

quoteFirst: All through brightness of afternoon bridge-gamble continue while I poke forth chocolate. At lateness of
quoteLast: 6 additional persons depart off from dinner-eat. I go bed without congratulation.
title: Hashimura Togo, Domestic Scientist

quoteFirst: The clock on his dresser said
quoteLast: . At Holman’s you were required to be in hall at ten unless you had secured leave, and even then eleven was the limit of absence. And here it was twenty-two minutes after! Well, Hal must have obtained permission, for he couldn’t get in now without ringing, and he surely wouldn’t be idiot enough to risk a row with faculty! And yet, he reflected as he began to undress, it wouldn’t be unlike Hal to take a chance just at the wrong time.
title: Follow the Ball
author: Barbour, Ralph Henry, 1870-1944
